instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
no visible water corossion, no short on bigcoils.
unable to dfu mode configurator unable to detect.
meter shows only 5.18v with 1,37amp
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> looping from 11.6V-12.23V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> looping in such way without battery?
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> stable?
Also check PMUs master/slave LDOs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
yes its looping without battery board is disconnected to the case.
<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL>: 3.8v stable
there is no full shorts on master/slave coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: SOLVED! found full short on <CAPACITOR>C7800</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>PP5V_BSTLQ_SPMU</SIGNAL> also replaced L7800

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Thanks for feedback.
Someone else may find it useful.
